intro: Zaluzania discoidea, commonly known as the white crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive white, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a robust, upright stem with hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and slightly serrated. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Zaluzania discoidea is often found in open woods and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
